Authors: H.M., Dung, Ho Manh; F., Sasajima, Fumio
Author full names: Dung, Ho Manh (7005442235); Sasajima, Fumio (6506990393)
Title: Determination of α and f for k0-NAA in irradiation sites with high thermalized neutrons
Source title: Journal of Radioanalytical and Nuclear Chemistry
Affiliations: Institute for Nuclear Research Vietnam, Dalat, Viet Nam; Japan Atomic Energy Agency, Kashiwa, Japan
Authors with affiliations: Dung, Ho Manh, Dept. for Nuclear Physics/Technology, Institute for Nuclear Research Vietnam, Dalat, Viet Nam; Sasajima, Fumio, Department of Reactor Safety Research, Japan Atomic Energy Agency, Kashiwa, Japan
Abstract: At the irradiation sites in a research reactor where neutrons are well thermalized, the "bare" irradiation methods for α and f determinations that are incorporated in the KAYZERO®/SOLCOI® v4.0 package seem to be unworkable. It is a fact that when carrying out the determination of α and f at the PN-3 irradiation site of the JRR-3M research reactor (Tokai, Japan) using the KAYZERO software, unacceptable results were obtained from experiment to experiment for α ranging from 0.10 to 0.999 and franging from 70 to 9999. The "Cd ratio" for a gold monitor in the PN-3 site is about 300. These unacceptable results have indicated the need for the application of Cd methods that are based on "Cd-covered" irradiation and "Cd-ratio" measurements at certain suitable and available monitors. Such Cd methods have not been incorporated into the KAYZERO v4.0 software. Therefore, computational and experimental procedures of the "Cd-covered" method for α and the "Cd-ratio" method for f determination have been presented in this paper. The PN-2 irradiation site of the JRR-3M reactor where the neutron thermalization is not high has a Cd ratio for gold of about 26. The commonly used "bare" irradiation methods can be applied together with the Cd methods so that all results may be presented as comparable data. The results of α and f determinations that were carried out in the PN-2 and PN-3 irradiation sites are presented. © 2025 Elsevier B.V., All rights reserved.

Title: Ferromagnetism and superconductivity in RuSr2RCu2O8 (R = Sm, Eu, Gd)
Source title: Physica C: Superconductivity and its Applications
Affiliations: University of Tsukuba, Tsukuba, Japan; Vietnam National University, Hanoi, Hanoi, Viet Nam; Japan Science and Technology Agency, Kawaguchi, Japan; National Institute for Materials Science, Tsukuba, Japan
Authors with affiliations: Hai, Do P., Institute of Materials Science, University of Tsukuba, Tsukuba, Japan, Faculty of Physics, Vietnam National University, Hanoi, Hanoi, Viet Nam; Kamisawa, Shiho, Institute of Materials Science, University of Tsukuba, Tsukuba, Japan; Kakeya, Itsuhiro, Institute of Materials Science, University of Tsukuba, Tsukuba, Japan, Japan Science and Technology Agency, Kawaguchi, Japan; Furuyama, Masafumi, Institute of Materials Science, University of Tsukuba, Tsukuba, Japan; Mochiku, Takashi, National Institute for Materials Science, Tsukuba, Japan; Kadowaki, Kazuo, Institute of Materials Science, University of Tsukuba, Tsukuba, Japan, Japan Science and Technology Agency, Kawaguchi, Japan
Abstract: Polycrystalline single phase RuSr<inf>2</inf>RCu<inf>2</inf>O<inf>8</inf> (R = Sm, Eu, Gd) samples have been synthesized by a new solid state reaction. We found superconductivity in two rare earths R = Sm and Eu with T<inf>s(R = 0)</inf> = 12 and 17 K, whereas ferromagnetism occurs at T<inf>c</inf> = 146 and 139 K in these samples, respectively, in addition to the previously reported RuSr<inf>2</inf>GdCu<inf>2</inf>O<inf>8</inf> with T<inf>s</inf> = 36 K and T<inf>c</inf> = 136 K. Huge resistivity broadening phenomena common to the high T<inf>c</inf> superconductors were observed in magnetic fields, which suggest that strong enhancement of superconducting fluctuations due to magnetic field, suppresses the occurrence of superconducting phase coherence in these compounds. © 2001 Published by Elsevier Science B.V. © 2017 Elsevier B.V., All rights reserved.

Authors: K., Kato, Koichi; V., Tu, Van
Title: Utilization of Bach Ho associated gas condensate in Vietnam for isomerate gasoline
Source title: Sekiyu Gakkaishi (Journal of the Japan Petroleum Institute)
Affiliations: Japan Energy Company, Limited, Toda, Japan; Vietnam Oil and Gas Corporation, Hanoi, Viet Nam
Authors with affiliations: Kato, Koichi, Japan Energy Company, Limited, Toda, Japan; Tu, Van, Vietnam Oil and Gas Corporation, Hanoi, Viet Nam
Abstract: The associated gas, about 1500 million cu m/yr, transported through a new PetroVietnam pipeline from Bach Ho oil field to Vung Tau, contains condensate as a heavier component and its more efficient utilization is expected to raise the economic value of the gas. It mainly contains C<inf>5</inf>-C<inf>7</inf> paraffin, its RON is estimated to be less than 70, and the production of aromatics for petrochemicals and production of high-octane isomerate gasoline components would be recommended. Isomerate gasoline is environmentally acceptable for Vietnam because it can eliminate the leaded gasoline currently used. The plant design and isomerization process were studied and its construction cost was estimated. The total investment cost of a 5000 bpd isomerization plant is about Y200 million. Economic studies show that the plant would be economically feasible, with return of investment, after corporate income tax, above 24.1%. © 2018 Elsevier B.V., All rights reserved.

Title: A fundamental study on Vietnamese crude oil refining - Normal paraffin separation and utilization

Abstract: A discussion covers properties of Vietnamese crudes and distillates characterized (like Bach Ho and Dai Hung crudes) with high paraffin content; experimental data on normal paraffin removal from distillates (mainly gas-oil fraction to meet product specifications; applications of recovered normal paraffins; design analysis; and economics study conducted to illustrate the feasibility of the projects. © 2018 Elsevier B.V., All rights reserved.

Authors: Q.T., Tuan Tran, Quoc Tuan; H.V.V., Huy, H. Vo V.; H., Duong-Lan, H.; L.N.T., Hoang, L. Nguyen T.; L., Tran-Dinh, L.
Author full names: Tuan Tran, Quoc Tuan (56732584900); Huy, H. Vo V. (57202643548); Duong-Lan, H. (57202649168); Hoang, L. Nguyen T. (57202644563); Tran-Dinh, L. (7801525476)
Title: Single-phase auto-reclosing of the Vietnam 500 kV system
Affiliations: Grenoble Electrical Engineering Laboratory (G2Elab), Grenoble, France; Ho Chi Minh City University of Technology - HCMUT, Ho Chi Minh City, Viet Nam; The University of Osaka, Suita, Japan; Electricity of Vietnam, Hanoi, Viet Nam

Vo V., Grenoble Electrical Engineering Laboratory (G2Elab), Grenoble, France; Duong-Lan, H., Ho Chi Minh City University of Technology - HCMUT, Ho Chi Minh City, Viet Nam; Hoang, L. Nguyen T., Power Systems Laboratory, The University of Osaka, Suita, Japan; Tran-Dinh, L., Electricity of Vietnam, Hanoi, Viet Nam
Abstract: The paper presents a study of single-phase auto-reclosing of the Vietnam 500 kV transmission system. The success of the single-phase auto-reclosing depends on the extinction of the secondary arc. Therefore, the influence of several factors such as shunt and neutral reactors, faulted phase and location, capacitive and inductive couplings and series capacitor discharge on the extinction of the secondary arc is investigated. The paper presents the influence of single-phase auto-reclosing on the transient stability of the Vietnamese power system. Finally, methods to increase the success of the single-phase auto-reclosing scheme also are investigated. © 2018 Elsevier B.V., All rights reserved.
